text: Hello All. I'm Thadryan. I do and teach computational bio - mostly biostats related to heart failure studies and visualization apps. I'm a Python fan and begrudging R user learning Julia out of curiosity and because I've been burned by factors one too many times!:v::skin-tone-2:

elements.text: Hello All. I'm Thadryan. I do and teach computational bio - mostly biostats related to heart failure studies and visualization apps. I'm a Python fan and begrudging R user learning Julia out of curiosity and because I've been burned by factors one too many times!

text: Welcome! We don't have a biostats channel, but do see <#CAKKFNYLD|biology> and <#C6821M4KE|statistics>

text: I'm not sure I'll ever be an expytriates but r-efugee for sure. I think it's got a great ecosystem wit a lot of great people but in terms of the language I learned to distrust it, not to love it, as I got more familiar

text:
It's really tongue-in-cheek; most people in both communities recognize that sometimes other languages really are the best choice for some problems. 

You'd be very welcome in <#CQG6KQMR7|expytriates>, especially if you're willing to answer python questions - a lot of the discussion in those channels are people that need to use the other language and need help.

text: We're not a very exclusive or discriminatory club here - and if you ever feel like people are ragging on python too much, hang out in <#C67TK21LJ|gripes> for a while :sweat_smile:
